contents.alt: Photo of the bells of the Caesar Tower

contents.contents: This church was completed several centuries ago but was altered repeatedly: the Saint-Quiriace spire was destroyed by thunderbolt in 1660 and the roof was added in the 17th century. The tower is connected to the underground galleries of the town.

question.contents: Why were bells installed at the top of the Caesar tower?

explanations.contents: As the Saint-Quiriace church was never completed, the bells were kept in the Caesar Tower.
